## Biography

Courtney David Mills concentrates his practice in medical malpractice defense. He represents hospitals, long-term care facilities, physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, clinics, and other health-care providers in the defense of medical negligence claims.

## Representative Matters

_Stringer v. Hammond-Whiting Care Ctr._, No., 2025 LX 420801 (Ind. Ct. App. 2025).

- Successfully obtained a dismissal for a long-term care facility based on a violation of the statute of limitations for a non-qualified health care provider subject to the Professional Services Statute.

_Andry v. Thorbecke,_ 2023 Ind. App. LEXIS 248 (Ind. Ct. App. 2023).

- Obtained a favorable reversal in favor of a physician pursuant to Indiana’s bright-line rule prohibiting untimely materials submitted in summary judgment proceedings.

_Incremedical, LLC v. Kennedy,_ 212 N.E.3d 220 (Ind. Ct. App. 2023).

- Successfully obtained a dismissal for an athletic trainer seeking protection under Indiana’s Medical Malpractice Act in a case of first impression regarding whether Athletic Trainers are considered Health-Care Providers under Indiana’s Medical Malpractice Act.

_Gresk for Estate of VanWinkle v. Demetris_, 96 N.E.3d 56 (Ind. 2018).

- Successfully obtained a dismissal for a physician seeking immunity under Indiana’s Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation law (“SLAPP” law) in the first SLAPP case brought before the Indiana Supreme Court.

_Vanwinkle v. Nichols_, 2015 WL 9275671 (S.D. Ind. 2015).

- Successfully obtained an early case dismissal for a physician who was sued in District Court for reporting suspected child abuse to DCS. The complaint alleged a conspiracy to violate a mother’s constitutional right of family integrity by causing DCS to separate the family.

## Beyond the Office

Courtney is actively involved in animal rescue groups and volunteers with ASPCA. He enjoys hiking, camping and wilderness survival.
